text:
[ At the command of Sri Rama, Vibheeshana escorts Sita to Rama's presence.]

स उवाचमहाप्रामस्सोऽभिवाद्यप्लवङ्गमः ।

रामंवचनमर्थज्ञोवरंसर्वधनुष्मताम् ।।6.117.1।।
meaning: महाप्राज्ञः highly learned, सःप्लवङ्गमः that monkey, वचनमर्थज्ञो meaningful, सर्वधनुष्मताम् foremost among the wielders of bow, वरम् choicest, तंरामम् Rama, अभिवाद्य greeted, उवाच spoke
translation: Highly learned Hanuman greeted and spoke meaningfully to Rama, the foremost among the wielders of bow.

meaning: कर्मणाम् these actions, अयम् this, आरम्बः started, यन्निमित्तः for whose sake, यः he who, फलोदयः has borne fruit, ताम् her, शोकसन्तप्ताम् immersed in grief, देवीम् noble lady, मैथिलीम् Mythili, द्रष्टुम् to see, अर्हसि ought to
translation: "You ought to see that noble lady Mythili, who was immersed in grief, for whose sake these actions were started and has borne fruit."

meaning: शोकसमाविष्टाः who is overcome with grief, सामैथिली she, Mythili, विजयम् victory, श्रुत्वा hearing, बाष्पपर्याकुलेक्षणा eyes filled with tears, त्वाम् you, द्रष्टुम् to see, अभिकाङ्क्षति desired
translation: "Mythili who is overcome with grief on hearing your victory, was filled with tears in her eyes and desired to see you."

meaning: पूर्वकात् earlier occasion, प्रत्ययात् expressed, विश्वस्तया trust, तया so also, अहम् I, उक्तः said, कृतार्थम् gratitude, सहलक्ष्मणम् with Lakshmana, भर्तारम् husband, द्रष्टुम् to see, इच्छामि desire
translation: "In an earlier occasion having known me and trusting me expressed that she desires to see Rama with Lakshmana after victory and with gratitude."

meaning: हनुमता Hanuman, एवम् in that way, उक्तः having spoken, धर्मभृताम् upholder of righteousness, वरः best, रामः Rama, ईषत् slightly, बाष्पपरिप्लुतः shed tears from eyes, सहसा suddenly, ध्यानम् thoughtful, आगच्छत् became
translation: When Hanuman had spoken like that, Rama, the upholder of righteousness, shed tears slightly and suddenly became thoughtful.

meaning: दीर्घम् long, उष्णम् hot, विनिःश्वस्य drawing breath, जगतीम् on the world, अवलोकयन् looking at, उपस्थितम् standing, मेघसङ्काशम् resembling a cloud in colour, विभीषणम् Vibheeshana, उवाच spoke
translation: Drawing a long hot breath, looking at the ground, he spoke to Vibheeshana, who was like a cloud standing there.

meaning: शिरःस्नाताम् after head bath, दिव्याङ्गरागाम् anointed with fragrance, दिव्यायभरणभूषिताम् decorated with wonderful ornaments, सीताम् Sita, इह here, उपस्थापय bring, चिरम् quickly, मा bring

एवम् in that manner, रामेण by Rama, उक्तः spoken, विभीषणः Vibheeshana, त्वरमाणः hastened, अन्तःपुरम् to the gynaeceum, प्रविश्य entered, स्वाभिः for his part, स्त्रीभिः women, सीताम् to Sita, अचोदयात् conveyed
translation: When Rama had spoken in that manner, Vibheeeshana for his part hastened to the Gynaeceum and assigned through the women to convey to Sita.

meaning: ततः then, श्रीमान् prosperous, राक्षसेश्वरःLord of Rakshasas, विभीषणः Vibheeshana, महाभागाम् the noble, सीताम् to Sita, दृष्टवा seeing, विनीतः his head, मूर्ध्निः head, बद्धाञ्जलिः with palms joined, उवाच spoke
translation: Then Vibheeshana, the prosperous Lord of the Rakshasas seeing Sita greeted her with palms joined together lifted it over his head (as a sign of respect).

meaning: वैदेही Vaidehi, दिव्याङ्गरागा anointed with wonderful fragrance, दिव्याभरणभूषिता decked with beautiful ornaments, यानम् palanquin, आरोह ascending, ते you, भद्रम् auspicious, भर्ता husband, त्वाम् you, द्रष्टुम् to see, इच्छति desires
translation: "Vaidehi! Anointed with a wonderful fragrance, decked with beautiful ornaments, auspicious and ascending the palanquin, your husband desires to see you."

meaning: एवम् in that way, उक्ता spoken, वैदेही Vaidehi, विभीषणम् to Vibheeshana, प्रत्युवाच replied, राक्षसेश्वर Lord of Rakshasas, अस्नात्वा without bath, भर्तारम् husband, द्रष्टुम् see, इच्छामि I desire
translation: Vibheeshana, having spoken that way, Vaidehi said to the Lord of Rakshasas that she would like to see him without having a bath.

meaning: तस्याः her, तत् that, वचनम् words, श्रुत्वा hearing, विभीषणःVibheeshana, प्रत्युवाच replied in turn, ते you, भर्ता husband, रामःRam, यथा so, आह I, तत् that, तथआ that only, कर्तुम् will do, अर्हसि ought to
translation: Hearing Sita's words Vibheeshana replied saying," You will and ought to do what your husband Rama has said."

meaning: पतिदेवता husband as god, साध्वी noble, मैथिली Mythili, तस्य her, तत् that, वचनम् words, श्रुत्वा hearing, भर्तृभक्त्या in devotion, वृता adorned, तथेति alright, प्रत्यभाषत replied in turn
translation: Noble Mythili (on hearing Vibheeshana), who looked upon her husband as God, said in reply, 'Alright'.

meaning: ततः thereafter, विभीषणः Vibheeshana, शिरःस्नाताम् head bath, प्रतिकर्मणा personal decoration, संयुक्ताम् together, महार्हाभरणोपेताम् best of ornaments, महार्हाम्बरधारिणीम् wonderful clothes, सीताम् Sita, दीप्ताम् glowing, परार्घ्याम्बरसंवृताम् covered with wonderful clothes, बहुभिः numerous, राक्षसैः Rakshasas, गुप्ताम् guarded by, शिबिकाम् palanquin, आरोप्य ascended, आजहार brought
translation: Thereafter Vibheeshana, making Sita to ascend the palanquin, covered with valuable clothes and guarded by numerous Rakshasas after she adorned herself in the best of ornaments and put on glowing wonderful clothes brought to Rama.

meaning: ततः thereafter, विभीषणः Vibheeshana, शिरःस्नाताम् head bath, प्रतिकर्मणा personal decoration, संयुक्ताम् together, महार्हाभरणोपेताम् best of ornaments, महार्हाम्बरधारिणीम् wonderful clothes, सीताम् Sita, दीप्ताम् glowing, परार्घ्याम्बरसंवृताम् covered with wonderful clothes, बहुभिः numerous, राक्षसैः Rakshasas, गुप्ताम् guarded by, शिबिकाम् palanquin, आरोप्य ascended, आजहार brought
translation: Thereafter Vibheeshana, making Sita to ascend the palanquin, covered with valuable clothes and guarded by numerous Rakshasas after she adorned herself in the best of ornaments and put on glowing wonderful clothes brought to Rama.

meaning: सः he, ज्ञात्वापि after knowing, द्यानम् meditative mood, आस्थितम् absorbed in thought, महात्मानम् great, अभिगम्य having reached, प्रणतः च greeting with folded palms, प्रहृष्टश्च full of joy, सीताम् Sita, प्राप्ताम् arrived, न्यवेदयत् announced
translation: Knowing that Sita reached also, great Rama was seen in a meditative mood absorbed in thought. Vibheeshana announced saying, 'Sita has been brought' and greeted with folded palms, full of joy.

meaning: रक्षोगृहचिरोषिताम् stayed in Rakshasa's abode for long, ताम् her, आगताम् reached, उपश्रुत्य having heard, राघवम् Raghava, हर्षः joyful, दैन्यम् indignation, रोषश्च anger, त्रयम् three, आविशत् experienced
translation: On hearing that Sita had arrived, who stayed in Rakshasa's abode for long, Raghava had experienced joy, indignation, and anger, all the three at the same time.

meaning: ततः then, राघवःRaghava, अहृष्टःdistressed, सविमर्शम् analysing with in, विचारयन् thinking, पार्श्वगतम् who had come near, विभीषणम् Vibheeshana, दृष्टवाseeing, इदम् these, वचःwords, अब्रवीत् spoke
translation: Raghava, analysed with in him, distressed and thinking deeply, seeing Vibheeshana close by, spoke these words.

meaning: नित्यम् always, मद्विजये my victory, रत sought, सौम्य gentle, राक्षसाधिपते Rakshasa king, वैदेहीVaidehi, शीघ्रम् quickly, मे my, सन्निकर्षम् near, समुपगच्छतु let her be brought
translation: "O gentle Vibheeshana, let Sita who sought my victory always be quickly brought near me."

meaning: तस्यराघवस्य Raghava's, तत् that, वचनम् words, श्रुत्वा on hearing, धर्मवित् faithful, विभीषणः Vibheeshana, तत्र there, तूर्णम् instantly, उत्सारणम् to disperse the people, कारयामास assigned
translation: On hearing Raghava's words, faithful Vibheeshana instantly assigned people to disperse from there.

meaning: तत्र then, कञ्चुकोष्णीषिणःwearing coats and turbans, वेत्ररर्जरपाणयःholding staffs in hand, तान् them, योधान् warriors, उत्सारयन्तः dispersed, समन्तात् all of them moved, परिचक्रमुःstarted
translation: Then those who were wearing coats and turbans, holding staffs in hand, warriors started moving and dispersed.

meaning: ऋक्षाणाम् Bears, वानराणां च Vanaras, राक्षसानां च and Rakshasas, सर्वशःall over, उत्सार्यमाणानि moving about, वृन्दानि hordes, अन्ततः vicinity, दूरम् distance, उत्तस्थुः driven
translation: The hordes of Bears, Vanaras and Rakshasas moving about all over there were driven away to a distance from the vicinity.

meaning: तेषाम् their, उत्सार्यमाणानाम् being driven, वायुना wind, उद्धूयमानस्य sound generated सागरस्य ocean, निःस्वनःइव like the storm, सुमहान् great, स्वनः sound, अभूत् heard
translation: The great sound heard there was like the uproar of an ocean lashed by a storm.

meaning: अथ now, राघवः Raghava, उत्सार्यमाणान् dispersing, जगत्याम् moving, जातसम्भ्रमान् excited to know, दृष्टवा seeing, दाक्षिण्यात् out of kindness, अमर्षात् resented, तत् that, वारयामास stopped
translation: Seeing them excited to know and dispersing, Raghava stopped them out of kindness.

meaning: रामः Rama, सम्रब्ध: च uproar, चक्षुषा with his gaze, प्रदहन्निव exhibiting anger, महाप्राज्ञम् highly intelligent, विभीषणम् Vibheeshana, सोपालम्भम् resenting, इदंवचः these words, अब्रवीत् spoke
translation: Exhibiting anger with his gaze at the uproar, Rama addressed the highly intelligent Vibheeshana resenting their action.

meaning: माम् me, अनादृत्य without regard, त्वया you, अयंजनः these people, किमर्थम् for what reason, क्लिश्यते troubling, उद्योगम् this excitement, निवर्तय stop, अयम् this, जनःpeople, मम my, स्वजनःown
translation: "Why are these people being troubled without disregard for me? Stop this excitement. They are my own people."

text:
न गृहाणि न वस्त्राणि न प्राकारास्तिरस्क्रिया ।

नेदृशाराजसत्कारावृत्तमावरणंस्त्रियाः ।।6.117.27।।
meaning: स्त्रियाः for women, गृहाणि houses, आवरणम् boundary wall, न not, वस्त्राणि clothes, न not, प्राकाराः protective wall, न not, तिरस्क्रिया screen of cloth, न not, ईदृशाः this kind of, राजसत्काराः royal treatment, न not, वृत्तम् surrounded
translation: "For women it is not the house, boundary wall or clothes or protective wall or screen of cloth or even this kind of royal treatment or surrounding, is the protection."

text:
व्यसनेषु न कृच्छ्रेषु न युद्धेषुस्वयंवरे ।

न क्रतौनोविवाहेवादर्शनंदूष्यतेस्त्रियाः ।।6.117.28।।
meaning: व्यसनेषु in times of difficulty, स्त्रियाः woman, दर्शनम् appearance, न दूष्यते not condemned, कृच्छ्रेषु in straits, युद्धेषु in conflicts, स्वयंवरे in selection of spouse, न not, क्रतौ sacrificial ceremony, न not, विवाहे वा marriage, न not
translation: "The appearance of a woman in public is not condemned in times of difficulty, in straits, in conflicts, in the selection of a husband, or in sacrificial ceremonies or marriage ceremonies."

meaning: साएषा she now, विपद्गताचैव in distress, महति great, कृच्छ्रे miserable, स्थिता situation, अस्याः her, दर्शने appearance, दोषः fault, नास्ति not, विशेषतः especially, मत्समीपे my presence
translation: "Sita is in distress and in a highly miserable situation. Her appearance is no fault especially in my presence."

meaning: तस्मात् therefore, शिबिकाम् palanquin, विसृज्य leaving, पद्भ्यामेव on foot only, उपसर्पतु advance towards, एते with the help of these, वनौकसः Vanaras, मम my, समीपे presence, वैदेहीम् Vaidehi, पश्यन्तु to see
translation: "Therefore, leaving the palanquin let Vaidehi walk on foot only towards me with the help of these Vanaras."

meaning: रामेण by Rama, एवम् in that way, उक्तःhaving spoken, सविमर्शःclearly, विभीषणम् Vibheeshana, सीताम् Sita, विनीतवत् reverently, रामस्य to Rama, उपानयत्conducted
translation: Rama having spoken clearly in that way, Vibheeshana reverently conducted Sita to Rama.

meaning: ततः thereupon, लक्ष्मणसुग्रीवौ Lakshmana and Sugriva, प्लवङ्गमः monkey, हनूमांश्च Hanuman too, रामस्य Rama's, वाक्यम् statement, निशम्य astonished, भृशम् highly, व्यथिताःdistressed, बभूवुः became
translation: There upon Lakshmana, Sugriva, and Vanara Hanuman, astonished at Rama's statement, became highly distressed.

meaning: कलत्रनिरपेक्ष्षैः no regard towards wife, अस्य his, दारुणैः harsh, इङ्गितैः gestures, राघवम् Raghava, सीतायाम् at Sita, अप्रीतम् displeased, तर्कयन्तिस्म discussed
translation: Seeing Rama having no regard towards Sita, and his harsh gestures, Lakshmana and Sugriva discussed if Rama was displeased with Sita?

meaning: सा he, मैथिलीतु Mythili also, लज्जया modesty, स्वेषु her own, गात्रेषु throat, अवलीयन्ती limbs shrinking, विभीषणेन by Vibheeshana, अनुगता followed by, भर्तारम् husband, अभ्यवर्तत approached
translation: Mythili, also adopting modesty, shrinking into her own limbs, approached her husband followed by Vibheeshana.

meaning: सौम्यतरानना gentle lady, पतिदेवता husband alone as god, विस्मयाश्च wondered, प्रहर्षाच्च joyful, स्नेहाच्च affectionately, भर्तुः husband, सौम्यम् gentle, मुकम् face, समुदैक्षत agreeable
translation: Sita, a gentle lady, who considered her husband as God only wondered with a mixed feeling of joy and affection and looked at the gentle face of Rama.
